text:
Meghan Markle and Kate Middleton discuss working as a family

Kate Middleton, 36, has been a part of the Royal Family for seven years, but actually began dating Prince William back in 2003. Over the years the Duchess of Cambridge has formed a close bond with William’s brother Prince Harry. Kate and Harry have often been spotted together at official engagements, and even worked together on the Head’s Up campaign, raising awareness for mental health. With such a close relationship Harry is reported to have wanted Kate Middleton’s approval before proposing to Meghan Markle According to royal expert Katie Nicholl, Kate is like a mentor to Harry, and therefore Harry wanted Kate’s seal of approval the most.

Kate Middleton: Duchess had a huge influence on Prince Harry’s proposal to Meghan Markle

Speaking to Grazia UK, Katie said: "Harry and Kate are very close, she’s been like a mentor to him and he wanted her seal of approval. “Kate is different to Meghan in many ways, but she has made great strides to help Meghan settle in.” While the Queen had to give her consent to the marriage, it was really Kate’s approval that Harry desired. Kate first met Meghan in November 2016, just four months after the now Duke and Duchess of Sussex started dating. According to Katie, Kate then met Meghan again in January 2017, where Meghan gifted Kate a personal journal.

Prince Harry sought Kate Middleton's approval before proposing to Meghan Markle in 2017

Kate and Harry have formed a close bond, knowing each other since around 2003

Kate and Harry are reported to have a close relationship, and Kate even “helped fill” the Princess Diana hole in Harry’s life, according to a 2017 Newsweek feature. The feature read: ”When she and William got engaged, Harry called her the big sister he never had. “He often pops into their apartment at Kensington Palace, where she cooks him a meal—roast chicken is reportedly a particular favourite." It seems that Meghan made a great impression on Kate, as Prince Harry proposed to then actress Meghan Markle, over his favourite roast chicken dinner. Following their announcement, Kate expressed her happiness for the couple, saying: "William and I are absolutely thrilled.

Harry proposed to Meghan over a roast chicken dinner back in 2017

Kate and Meghan were spotted enjoying a day out at Wimbledon together earlier this month
